sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
    A--B
    |  |\
    |  | \
    C--D--E
```

Can you find a Hamiltonian cycle in the above graph? If yes, write down the sequence of vertices visited in the cycle. If no, explain why.
message_2:
Yes, there is a Hamiltonian cycle in the given graph. A Hamiltonian cycle is a closed loop on a graph where every node (vertex) is visited exactly once. The sequence of vertices visited in the cycle is as follows:

A -> B -> E -> D -> C -> A
